summary: This document contains due diligence research results for Jeepers, Inc., including negative and non-negative media findings related to individuals and corporate activities. It highlights the importance of compliance and the need for escalation in case of significant findings. The document also includes a biography of Karol Steven E, an independent director at Carpenter Technology Corporation, detailing his professional background and recent stock transactions. This document discusses the nomination of five candidates for the board of magicJack VocalTec Ltd by Carnegie Technologies and its founder Paul Posner. It highlights the qualifications of the nominees and the strategic alternatives process the current board is seeking to undertake. This document contains various financial records related to multiple entities named 'JEEPERS' and their associated debts, judgments, and tax liens across different states. It includes details of small claims judgments, civil filings, and tax liens, indicating financial struggles and legal actions taken against these entities. This document contains a series of initial filings and amendments related to the company Jeepers! Inc. and its secured party Leasing Technologies International, Inc. The filings detail various collateral agreements and equipment leases, primarily focusing on computer equipment and other leased assets. This document contains various financial filings related to a company named Jeepers, Inc., including amendments, assignments, and secured party information. It details the relationships between Jeepers, Inc. and several banks, as well as the collateral involved in these transactions. The document also includes information about real property and vehicle ownership associated with the company. This document contains a comprehensive business report detailing various companies associated with the name 'Jeepers' and related entities. It includes addresses, phone numbers, and business statuses, as well as information on executives and corporate filings. The report highlights the presence of multiple Jeepers entities across different states and their respective legal statuses. This document contains various financial records related to multiple entities named 'JEEPERS' and their associated debts, judgments, and filings across different jurisdictions. It includes details about civil suits, judgments, and UCC filings, indicating financial struggles and legal issues faced by these entities. This document contains a series of UCC filings related to various entities named 'JEEPERS' and their secured parties, primarily detailing amendments, assignments, and initial filings. The filings include information about collateral, secured parties, and the status of the debtors, indicating financial transactions and obligations. This document contains a series of financial filings related to various entities named 'JEEPERS' across multiple states, primarily focusing on secured party information and collateral details. The filings include initial filings and amendments with Imperial Bank as a secured party, detailing various types of collateral such as accounts receivable, inventory, and general intangibles. This document contains various financial filings related to multiple entities, primarily focusing on the 'Jeepers, Inc.' and its associated filings, including amendments and assignments. It details secured party information, addresses, and various filing numbers, indicating the financial status and transactions of these entities. This document appears to contain a list of individuals associated with various companies, detailing their roles and the duration of their positions. It also includes information about registered agents, possible employees, business associates, and various companies related to real estate and other services. The document is marked as confidential and contains numerous entries with associated addresses and statuses. This document contains a court ruling from the Court of Appeals of Ohio regarding the case of David A. Peoples, who appealed a judgment denying his motion to find a prior judgment entry void. The court affirmed the lower court's decision, stating that the omission of a charge did not render the judgment void and that the trial court had jurisdiction to sentence him. This document appears to be a research summary related to Jeepers, Inc., focusing on negative news and legal cases associated with the company. It includes search parameters for various legal and news sources but ultimately reports no results for the queries made.

events.title: Nomination Announcement
events.description: Carnegie Technologies announces the nomination of five candidates for the board of magicJack VocalTec Ltd.

events.title: Nabil N. El-Hage's Appointment
events.description: Nabil N. El-Hage starts his fifth year as a director of Argo Group International Holdings.

events.title: Initial Filing
events.description: Multiple initial filings for Jeepers! Inc. were made on this date, detailing secured party agreements.

events.title: Amendment Filing
events.description: Multiple amendment filings for Jeepers, Inc. were recorded on this date.

events.title: Assignment Filing
events.description: An assignment filing for Jeepers, Inc. was recorded on this date.

events.title: UCC-3 Termination Filing
events.description: A UCC-3 termination filing for Jeepers, Inc. was recorded on this date.

events.title: Motion to Find Judgment Entry Void Filed
events.description: David A. Peoples filed a motion arguing that his judgment of conviction was void due to the omission of a charge.

events.title: Court Ruling on Appeal
events.description: The Court of Appeals of Ohio affirmed the lower court's judgment denying David A. Peoples' motion.
